pages.title: About Me
pages.subtitle: Design as translation — between people, systems, and emotions.
pages.story: I’m a Service and UX Designer with roots in product design and front‑end development. My journey has taken me from ISDI Parsons (India) to the Royal College of Art, London, collaborating with organizations like the NHS and Local‑to‑Local on human‑centered projects. I believe design is not decoration — it’s dialogue. It listens before it acts. My practice focuses on clarity, empathy, and translating insights into usable, thoughtful systems. When I’m not designing, you’ll find me sketching, traveling, or studying how small interactions shape trust between people and technology.
education: MA Service Design — Royal College of Art, London
B.Des Product Design — ISDI Parsons, Mumbai
pages.philosophy: Design begins where understanding meets imagination.

pages.title: Let’s Connect
pages.intro: I’m currently open to design collaborations, freelance projects, or full‑time roles focused on UX, service design, or product strategy.
